name: Natural_logarithm_60
latex: {\displaystyle {\begin{aligned}{\frac {d}{dx}}\ln x&=\lim _{h\to 0}{\frac {\ln(x+h)-\ln x}{h}}\\&=\lim _{h\to 0}\left[{\frac {1}{h}}\ln \left({\frac {x+h}{x}}\right)\right]\\&=\lim _{h\to 0}\left[\ln \left(1+{\frac {h}{x}}\right)^{\frac {1}{h}}\right]\quad &&{\text{all above for logarithmic properties}}\\&=\ln \left[\lim _{h\to 0}\left(1+{\frac {h}{x}}\right)^{\frac {1}{h}}\right]\quad &&{\text{for continuity of the logarithm}}\\&=\ln e^{1/x}\quad &&{\text{for the definition of }}e^{x}=\lim _{h\to 0}(1+hx)^{1/h}\\&={\frac {1}{x}}\quad &&{\text{for the definition of the ln as inverse function.}}\end{aligned}}}

name: Natural_logarithm_99
latex: {\displaystyle \int \tan x\,dx=\int {\frac {\sin x}{\cos x}}\,dx=-\int {\frac {{\frac {d}{dx}}\cos x}{\cos x}}\,dx=-\ln \left|\cos x\right|+C=\ln \left|\sec x\right|+C.}
